Privacy Policy: AutoInsurance.com

Thanks for visiting AutoInsurance.com (the “Site”). The Site is an online property of Locate My Degree and its associated companies (“Locate My Degree,” “we” or “us”). This privacy policy (“Privacy Policy”) goes over the practices related to privacy which are used by the site. You agree to these terms and conditions, in their entirety, when you: (a) visit or utilize the Site; (b) subscribe to our email list on the Site, or through any other means; (c) sign up on the Site educational products and services (“education services”) from any outside service providers (“Third Party Service Providers”); and/or (d) purchase or attempt to purchase any products from Locate My Degree.

Due to the California Financial Privacy Act and the Vermont Consumer Protection Act, 8 V.S.A. 10202, if you live in the State of California or Vermont and you’d like to disclosure of your personal information to any third-party for marketing purposes, please contact us at info@marketingmadeeasyllc.com. Be aware that when California or Vermont residents opt-out from allowing any information to be shared, these individuals can continue to receive offers directly from the site.

Upon registering at the site, you agree and acknowledge that your personal information will be included in the Locate My Degree database and this info may be shared with outside parties for the purpose of marketing.

IP Address

Upon visiting the Site, our server will immediately recognize your IP address and where you came from. This information is used to identify you and to track demographic information about visitors. This information is also used to diagnose technical problems, to administer the Site and to serve you better in using the features on the Site.

Cookies: The first time that a user gives us an e-mail address while using the Site, we give that PC an identification number with a cookie. When returning to the site, the cookie recalls the user’s e-mail address. This information might be utilized (a) to determine the purpose of the original use; (b) to automatically provide the user’s information in data fields (c) to avoid showing the same ads and promotions to the user(d) to provide access to the best promotions that may be of interest to that user. To learn more about cookies, visit www.cookiecentral.com. Adjusting your browser settings can disable or prevent cookies.

Data Collection Methods: An action tag or a web-beacon (also known as a clear gif or a pixel tag) tracks actions of visitors when viewing an advertisement. These tags are 1×1 pixel pictures embedded in websites which are used to collect data. These tags can be used to count how many times a user clicks on a banner, or how many times another action is taken. We may keep the data from these tags indefinitely, and may share information from these cookies and action tags with our associates.

Personal Info Collected

When signing up for education services on the site, we will collect your personal info. We’ll also collect information if you agree to this privacy policy. The type of data we may collect is (a) your e-mail address; (b) your state; and/or (c) any other data.

How We Use Personal Information

When you submit your information to us, we may show it to our third party associates. They can use this information for any lawful purpose including completing your application for a class. Please be aware that Locate My PC does not actually provide services directly. Education services are provided by third parties, and they will determine the terms and conditions of those services.

We use the information that we receive to provide the best opportunities and offers to our visitors from third parties. These partners may include: (a) direct marketing companies, and providers of information including verification; (b) email marketing companies; (c) direct marketers; (d) SMS text-based marketers (where permitted by applicable law); and (e) telemarketers.

We might also hire other companies and individuals to complete certain tasks for us. For example, these companies may engage in sending out email communications and analyzing data. They may have access to your personal information, but can only use it for the specific tasks that we assign. We also purchase third-party email lists. Those who don’t wish to be subscribed can unsubscribe by clicking on the appropriate link in the email.

We may also use your information to complete customer service related tasks. Your information may also be used to help us manage our business internally.

We may also release personal information if we believe that the user was using our products or Site: (i) in violation of our privacy policy or terms and conditions; (ii) to break the law; (iii) if the info is subpoenaed; (iv) if our business is sold(v) when we decide it’s necessary, such as to be in compliance with the CAN-SPAM Act of 2003, and Federal Trade Commission implementing regulations. Without limitation, we may share, sell, rent, lease and/or otherwise distribute personal information with/to any third party for any and all uses permitted by this Privacy Policy and applicable law.

When you register on the site, you agree that this act is an inquiry or application for purposes of the Amended Telemarketing Sales Rule (16 CFR §310 et seq.), (the “Rule”) and appropriate do not call laws. Because of this, we reserve the right to contact you even if your number is on the Federal Trade Commission’s do not call list.

When submitting your personal info, you agree to be contacted through mobile marketing by us or by our third-party partners (where, as long as this type of marketing is allowed by law). We retain the right to contact you through your mobile device despite being listed on the Federal Trade Commission’s do not call list. You agree that we can share, sell, rent, lease and/or otherwise distribute your mobile data to any third-party for any and all non-marketing uses permitted by this Privacy Policy and applicable law.

You have the right to unsubscribe from our emails at any time. To unsubscribe, just click the link at the end of the message and follow the instructions. We process all of these requests promptly. In some cases, you may receive further communication from us if you have subscribed to another email program. In this case, you can always unsubscribe from that email as well. We can keep our services free because our visitors allow our third-party marketers to contact them. When you allow our third-parties to contact you, you’ll be able to receive free information and products from time to time. You can request to not have your personal information shared with third parties by sending us an email at info@marketingmadeeasyllc.com.

How We Use Aggregated Data and Demographic Info

We use this information to make our site more appropriate for our visitors. It is also used to display more appropriate advertisements to our visitors. We sometimes provide this demographic information to our advertisers as well.

We keep the right to provide demographic data for lawful purposes. This is generic data about our visitors, but it does not include any identifying information. When you open an account with us, you agree to allow us to distribute this generic data to third-parties. By agreeing to this Privacy Policy, you agree to allow us to communicate with third-parties when we decide it’s necessary.

Other Websites

We may also include links to other sites on our site. Locate My Degree is not responsible for the content or practices of other websites. Sometimes, you may be able to make purchases from these other sites with a credit card. Locate My Degree is not responsible for how they utilize your information or process payments.

Offers from Third-Parties

Locate My Degree provides the opportunity for users to receive special offers from third parties. When you ask to receive such offers, your personal information which was obtained during the collection process will be shared with the applicable third party so that you can receive the product or offer without having to fill out another form.

Security Precautions

We strive to keep our user’s information safe at all times. Any time a user submits his information, it is safeguarded both online and offline. Keeping your info private is critical to us. Our servers are kept in a secure physical location. We go to lengthy measures to make sure that your personal information is not lost or misused in some way. Although we do everything we can, please understand that any online transmission is not 100% secure. This means that any transmission of data to our site cannot be guaranteed to be safe. Any time you submit data, it’s at your own risk. Just understand that access to your data is limited an not available for public use. We keep our user’s information restricted in the office. Employees are only granted access to this information in order to complete a specific task. Every employee in our business strives to keep user data safe and secure. Any employee who does not keep data secure to our specifications will be disciplined or terminated. We’ll notify you if there are any security breeches in regards to your personal information. If a breech occurs, you’ll be notified via email. In some cases, your notice may be delayed in order to work with law enforcement or to assess the severity of the damage.

Minors

Any visitors 18 years of age or younger should not post any personal information at the site. Individuals who are younger than 18 years old aren’t allowed to get on the site, and we don’t knowingly collect their personal info. We encourage parents to spend time with their children online and to monitor their activities to ensure safe usage.

Opting Out or Removing Your Information

We will remove any personal information that you have provided at your request. Just email us at info@marketingmadeeasyllc.com. When removing information, it will only affect any future communications or offers that we may send out. Deleting your data will not impact any past transactions that you have engaged in with us, which may have been shared with a third-party. To change your preferences with third parties, you’ll have to contact them directly.

We give users the opportunity to opt out of receiving any offers from third parties. Users can unsubscribe simply by following the instructions at the end of each message.We can only process an unsubscribe request if the user registered with us to begin with. Otherwise, the unsubscribe request will need to be processed with a third-party.

Any information that is sent from third-parties is prepared well in advance, which means users may still receive e-mail messages for up to ten (10) days after they engage in the unsubscribe process. If emails are still being received after they go through the 10 day waiting period, they should contact us at info@marketingmadeeasyllc.com.

No Liability for Unauthorized Changes

WE SHALL NOT BE LIABLE FOR DAMAGES OF ANY KIND COMING FROM THE USE OF THE SITE OR FOR THE ANY MODIFICATION OF CONTENT PROVIDED BY US, OUR ADVERTISING PARTNERS OR ANY OTHER THIRD PARTIES.

Your Acceptance of these Terms

When you use this site, request information from us, or engage in any offers from our site, you accept the terms of the privacy policy. We keep the right to change, alter, modify, or amend this policy at any time, and for any reason. All changes to the Privacy Policy will take effect as soon as the new policy is posted on the site. If you are concerned about how your information is used, you’ll need to check this page from time to time. If you continue to use the site or respond to our offers after we post the changes, this indicates that you accept the changes. If you will not agree to the terms of this Privacy Policy, you can unsubscribe by clicking here.

Contacting Us About Concerns or Questions

If you have any questions about the Privacy Policy or about how we use information, do not hesitate to contact us at info@marketingmadeeasyllc.com
